climbs.name: Crack of virtually insured destruction
climbs.fa: Nathan Benjamin,Robert  Dalton and Steve Delisle ,June 2020

content.description:
Start as for Ten Eh? and continue up this crack .there is a break in the crack about 2/3 of the way up may prove committing for the 5.8 leader. The anchor can be reached safely to set a top rope. (Description by Nathan Benjamin)



Go to the centre of The  Green  Wall area there you will find multiple ring anchors use any of them to rap down to the ledge known as Nate’s Nook after that climb any of the seven climbs that start from the ledge.

Standard rack to #1 camalot.2 Ring anchors.

climbs.name: Gate way to Nate’s Nook
climbs.fa: Robert Dalton,,Steve Delisle and Nathan Benjamin

content.description:
Start as for Ten Eh? And transfer into the crack above and right of the crack you started on. climb the second crack and finish up the slab above using the lone bolt.The anchor can be reached safely to set a top rope (Description by Nathan Benjamin)



Go to the Centre of The Green Wall area there you will find multiple ring anchors use any of them to rap down to the ledge known as Nate’s Nook after that climb any of the seven climbs that start from the ledge.

Standard rack to #1 Camelot,1 bolt and 2 ring anchors.

This climb starts on a large ledge. Climb the bolted face climb. Excellent technical movement, and a couple burly moments make for fantastic variety. Plenty of opportunities to rest, and an excellent view to enjoy. The name suggests the view is at times a bit more interesting.

This ledge can be accessed by rappelling off of a tree to reach this climb's anchor at the lip. Hiking along the top of the crag you pass a very open area with exposed rock, a small boulder on your right, and a great view. Keep hiking along the trail until it reaches its next high point. The path to the lip of the cliff on your right should lead you to the top of this climb - see pictures.
8 bolts, rings

climbs.name: Starfish
climbs.fa: Nathan Benjamin,Steve Delisle and Robert Dalton  June 2020

content.description:
Start 2 meters left of Ten Eh? Then climb  various features as you head up towards the short dihedral where moving right will lead you to a bolt on your left .step across the dihedral and carefully establish yourself on the slab before exiting up the pockets and crack to your left this route finishes at the Covid anchors .(Description by Nathan Benjamin)



Go to the centre of The Green Wall area there you will find multiple ring anchors use any of them to rap down to the ledge known as Nate’s nook after that climb any of the seven climbs that start from the ledge.

Standard rack to #.75 camalot. 1 bolt ,2 ring anchors.

From Nate’s Nook ledge start up the left trending crack with a small tree growing in it traverse right under their roof to a flake in the rock and pull over the roof head up and right into the left trending crack (for a fun variation head straight up over the bulge from the jug at the start of the crack ).at the next roof traverse right and into big holes to gain a massive ledge. from the ledge follow the easy arcing flake and hand crack to get to a set of rings(Description by Nathan Benjamin)



Go to the centre of The Green Wall area there you will find multiple ring anchors use any of them to rap down to the ledge known as Nate’s Nook after that climb any of the seven climbs that  start from the ledge.

Standard rack to about a#1 Camelot

From the ledge know as Nate’s Nook,climb the sport route on the left. It is Slabby ,thoughtful and has a fun crux that may feel unlikely at first. when you reach the upper ledge use the arcing crack to reach the bolt .you can also hang an extended draw on your way down if you don’t enjoy exciting run out , just be mindful of the ledge climb the slab you finish and enjoy the Stellar view.(description from Nathan Benjamin)



Go to the centre of The Green Wall area there you will find multiple ring anchors, use any of them to rap down to the ledge known as Nate Nook after that climb any of the seven climbs that start from the ledge.

9 Bolts 2 Ring anchors.
The central area of the cliff.
